 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּר‎</span>] **noun [masculine]** ==basket-saddle==, **\*\***for ***basket-saddle*** read &lt; ***camelpalankeen***; the palankeen, or tent-like erection, on the saddle (Burckh<sup>Bedouins and Wahabys, 266</sup> Doughty<sup>Arab. Des. i. 437. ii. 304</sup> Lane<sup>Modern Egyptians (5) ii. 158 and elsewhere</sup>), which seems intended here, is distinct from the basket or pannier (in which some women also traveled, Porter<sup>Travels ii. 232.</sup>). <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּכַרהַֿגָּמָל‎</span> [[Gen.31.34|Gen 31:34]] ***in the camel-basket***, i.e. the basket-saddle of the camel, a sort of palankeen bound upon the saddle proper (compare [[BDB#Kn|Kn]] in [[BDB#Di|Di]] and references) II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּר‎</span> see in alphabetical order. 



 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּר‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Ps.65.14|Ps 65:14]]</sup> pasture (√ dubious; [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] derives from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּר‎</span> ***lamb*** (=lamb-pasturage); [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>ZAW x. (1890) 186</sup> from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כרה‎</span>, and compare Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***kirû***</u></abbr> [which however = ***nursery of trees, grove*** [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 353</sup>], Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhJAAiAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAkACIAAAJfjI+py+0HwJsuRoqTlbnbznDKBWqbaW5iqFbf6p7LV6pwQJf4uea6zfHpDC3ibTgjIWPHJULoHCmjySYVSoVMh02sZ2u0Zmw78A/oBW3N52zVnRIjZfDilVxPw/d8RQEAOw=="> ***cistern***; [[BDB#Hom|Hom]]<sup>NS 100</sup> from  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כרר‎</span> q. v., originally = ***round enclosure***); — singular only <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּד נִדְחָ֑בּ‎</span> [[Isa.30.23|Isa 30:23]] ***a roomy pasture***; plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּרִים‎</span> [[Ps.37.20|Ps 37:20]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַצּאֹןלָֽבְשׁוּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כ‎</span> [[Ps.65.14|Ps 65:14]] ***the pastures are clothed with the sheep*** (&gt; [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>l.c.</sup> who translates ***lambs*** [[Ps.37.20|Ps 37:20]] after [[BDB#Aq|Aq]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] and [[Ps.65.14|Ps 65:14]], and understands [[Isa.30.23|Isa 30:23]] of a definite plural). — 

 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּר‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==he-lamb, battering-ram== (Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***kirru***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Zim|Zim]] in [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>ZAW x. (1890), 186</sup>; perhaps ***lamb*** from ***dancing, skipping, galloping*** in field; (***battering-***) ***ram*** as in English, from butting; compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***ram*** and ***buttress***, [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]; also ***battering-ram*** compare [[BDB#Dozy|Dozy]]<sup>ii. 440</sup>); — singular only [[Isa.16.1|Isa 16:1]] ***the lamb of the ruler*** (as tribute); elsewhere plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּרִים‎</span> [[Amos.6.4|Amos 6:4]]; [[1Sam.15.9|1Sam 15:9]]; [[2Kgs.3.4|2Kgs 3:4]]; [[Jer.51.40|Jer 51:40]] (in simile), [[Ezek.27.21|Ezek 27:21]]; [[Ezek.39.18|Ezek 39:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֵלֶב כ‎</span> [[Deut.32.14|Deut 32:14]] ***the fat of lambs***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דַּם כ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְעַתּוּדִים‎</span> [[Isa.34.6|Isa 34:6]] ***the blood of lambs and goats***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּרִים‎</span> = ***battering-rams*** [[Ezek.4.2|Ezek 4:2]]; [[Ezek.21.27|Ezek 21:27]] (twice in verse) (in v<sup>a</sup> [[BDB#Co|Co]] reads <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂרִים‎</span>, compare [[BDB#AV|AV]]; [[BDB#MT|ᵑ0]] [[BDB#RV|RV]] as above). — See also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בֵּית כָּ֑ר‎</span> p. I I I above
